page.title: 09CROPS ON A FEN EDGE FARM
page.content: Three crops are grown on{Chalk} {Farm}in a three-year rotation. They are: wheat for flour, bread or biscuits; barley, which is sold for malting to make beer,whisky or vinegar; and grass to make hay. The grass acts as a 'break' crop and gives the soil a rest. The farmer grows only winter barley; in March, while the barley is growing, the grass seed is sown amongst it and both crops grow together until the barley is cut in August. There are no animals kept on the farm apart from a pet dog and a goat. The present farmer's father used to keep both pigs and sheep, but they were not very profitable and needed someone to look after them every day of the year.
